Operations Specialist     Chelsea        Who We Are     Phoenix Charter Academy aims to show the world what all young people can do, and to defy the limitations of societal assumptions, classism, and racism. Phoenix Charter Academy was founded on the unwavering belief that all students can succeed at high levels. While this mantra is typical of high-performing schools, particularly those in the charter sector, Phoenix truly endeavors to reach every student, focusing on a growing number on the margins of the traditional public district education system: students who have dropped out of high school, students who are parenting children of their own, students who are or have been involved with the juvenile justice system, students who are older and new to the country and cannot gain access to public schooling, and students who are under-credited relative to the number of years they have spent enrolled in high school. We believe that these students, like all students, are completely capable of developing the skills necessary to set themselves up for lifetimes of economic prosperity and success. We support our students with individually tailored and academically rigorous curricula and push them to succeed at the highest levels by providing them with the resources and mentoring that they need to reach their full potential.        Why Our Work is Important     Students across America are dropping out of high school at an alarming rate. Dropping out of high school has a substantial impact on a young person’s life. Over the course of their lifetime, an individual who drops out of high school is more likely to have reduced earning power, greater social service dependency, increased rates of criminal involvement, and shorter life expectancy. Phoenix Charter Academies addresses this trend by creating environments where students can demonstrate their talent and resilience and prepare themselves for success through high school, college, and beyond.        Commitment to DEI     At Phoenix, we recognize the importance of forming a school community inclusive of all visible and invisible identities. We act to ensure that our students and staff always see reflections of themselves and their communities.        At Phoenix, we aim to break down systemic barriers by providing access to resources, experiences, and differentiated supports for historically marginalized groups.        At Phoenix, we solicit, value, understand, connect, and leverage multiple perspectives and experiences. We invite all perspectives except those that perpetuate oppression or dehumanization.        At Phoenix we do not just accept difference - we celebrate it, support it, and thrive on it for the benefit of our scholars and the communities we serve. We believe difference makes us stronger. Phoenix Charter Academy is an equal opportunity employer and as such, we do not discriminate against any team member or candidate because of race, creed, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, disability, age, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law. Phoenix Charter Academy is committed to making any reasonable accommodation necessary to support an individual's employment.        Qualities of Phoenix staff member :         Unwavering belief in our students  - Phoenix staff operate with the deeply held belief that all young people want to and can succeed even in the face of substantial systemic barriers and societal constraints.      Continuous Improvement  - Phoenix staff approach problem solving with curiosity and desire to understand the perspectives of others. They carry an internalized sense of “I can always learn more” and know that adults at Phoenix must model the qualities of being open-minded and willing to make mistakes and learn from them. Phoenix staff members embody “lifelong learner” mindsets and strive for constant improvement.      Eager to Learn  - Phoenix staff must be able to learn as they go in a fast paced, ever evolving, urgent environment. They have the desire to receive direct feedback and the ability to implement the feedback into practice quickly.      Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion  - Phoenix staff commit to understanding the ways that their self-identity and experiences impact and interact with their daily work, their colleagues, and their students, and work toward furthering initiatives that promote a more equitable society.        The Opportunity     The Operations Specialist will work closely with the Chelsea Director of Operations. We are looking for an exceptional problem solver who is highly organized with excellent communication skills, collaboration skills and attention to detail. Bilingual candidates are highly encouraged to apply.     .     Your Contribution     In addition to demonstrating the qualities of a Phoenix staff member, the Operations Specialist will be responsible for the following:        Special Projects         Library      Run the Library for student use 3-4 days per week, for a total of 3-8 open hours per week  Manage the Library collection - organize books and materials, ensure all items are properly cataloged, and track student borrowing and returning. Provide recommendations for purchasing new materials for the Library collection.  Create and facilitate a long-term schoolwide system for teacher and student use of both the Phoenix Library and the Chelsea Public Library.  Actively promote a culture of reading in the school community.      Technology Organization      Create systems and processes to organize the school’s technology resources, including Chromebooks, headsets, projectors, etc.      Nutrition Program      Support the re-design of the Nutrition program at both the network and school-based levels.        Operations         Support student schedule change processes in Powerschool, both individual schedule changes as well as batch schedule changes. In collaboration the Director of Curriculum & Instruction and the Manager of Post-Secondary Success.      Support the maintenance of cumulative scholar files.      Support school duties and building coverage schedules in collaboration with the Director of School Culture.      Support the set-up for all state-mandated testing, with Leadership Team support, including MCAS, ACCESS, and NWEA, including ordering and processing materials, writing coverage schedules, etc.      Manage the distribution of breakfast, lunch, and snack each day.        Supplies & Resources         Support supply ordering and distribution.        Facilities         Support the maintenance of the facility (classrooms, offices, public spaces, etc.) so that it is clean, presentable, and in working order at all times.      Immediately troubleshoot problems that may arise.      Support the proper functioning and maintenance of the heating, electrical, plumbing, roofing, and other building systems in collaboration with Network Staff      Support security of the facility, including managing the alarm system, camera system, key distribution and tracking, and any other security issues.      Support building safety systems in case of fire, lockdown, or other emergencies.      Support tracking systems of all school property including copiers, computers, fax machines, furniture, etc.        Head of School Support         Assist the Head of School with troubleshooting, planning visits to the school, etc.      Complete projects as directed by the Head of School.        School and Staff Culture         Internalize the mission and make it central to all decisions and actions.      Support a positive, safe, and professional learning environment for all scholars.      Build meaningful and supportive relationships with students to facilitate academic growth and achievement      Acknowledge positive behavior or achievement and reward scholars.      Support communication with parents and other adult supporters through phone calls, email correspondence, and/or in-person meetings           Qualifications & Competencies         Associate’s degree required.      6 months of direct scholar-serving (teaching, tutoring, academic support, etc.) experience preferred.      Bilingual/Spanish-speaking candidates are highly encouraged to apply.      Communication  - Conveys information effectively and efficiently using verbal, non-verbal, and written communication skills; has knowledge and flexibility to communicate across lines of difference.      Scholar Orientation  - Works to deepen understanding of scholars and centers the needs of scholars in all aspects of how the work is done.      Adaptability  - Adjusts and strategically aligns work to the school's mission while navigating complex and changing environments internally and externally.      Employment is based on qualifications for the role as well as a successful background check.        Our Commitment to Staff         We commit to providing a supportive environment and giving the professional development, coaching, and resources needed to be successful      We commit to creating an open and tolerant culture that embraces diversity and fosters equity and inclusion through affinity groups and continuous capacity building supported by our Racial, Justice and Equity working group        **The Network retains the right to modify this job description at any time, for any reason, at the Network’s sole discretion**

About The Position         DeepCure is seeking an exceptional and highly motivated Scientist to join our diverse and collaborative discovery team. You will apply your knowledge of biochemistry, molecular, and cellular biology to drive the Biology and Pharmacology aspects of DeepCure’s drug discovery portfolio.          In this role, you will work hands-on in DeepCure’s Boston lab space, as well as expand our internal capabilities by supporting the management of work conducted with external CROs. You’ll own the entire experimental process- from design to execution and analysis, and prepare meticulous summaries of data to share with the cross-functional project teams.                As a member of a fast-growing, early-stage company, your contributions will have a significant impact on the organization, and you will have tremendous opportunities for growth as the company expands.                You will have fantastic support from a team of outstanding scientists and AI experts, along with dedicated facilities, and will be able to interact with internal and external project teams and experience the real-world impact of your efforts on the advancement of our drug discovery pipeline towards the clinic.          In-lab requirement will vary based on needs and ability, with a tentative initial breakdown of 50% lab work.        Requirements              Ph.D. in a Biology-focused field (e.g. Cancer Biology, Immunology, Pharmacology etc), or M.S with >6+ years industry experience       Strong sense of scientific integrity and demonstrated ability to independently design and execute fit-for-purpose experiments to test key hypotheses.       Can-do attitude to innovatively troubleshoot and solve complex problems, optimize and adapt experimental protocols and work in a fast-paced environment and across multiple projects.       Proficiency in a broad range of experimental techniques spanning biochemistry (e.g. binding and enzyme assays), molecular biology (e.g. construct design,) cellular biology (e.g. cell line engineering via CRISPR etc, immunoassays) and in/ex vivo studies (e.g. processing of animal tissue samples, CDX/PDX)       Experience with quantitative characterization of small molecules in a medium-throughput format is highly desired       Candidates must be located in or willing to relocate to Boston, MA. Relocation assistance is available.            Benefits         We offer a competitive salary and well-rounded, strong benefits package including:               A leadership team that values and prioritizes your professional development      Flexible work hours      Unlimited paid leave and sick time      401(k) plan with employer matching      Healthcare, vision, dental, and life insurance plans for you and your dependents      Generous parental leave      Tax-advantaged commuter benefits for public transportation or parking.      Work in a cool and vibrant space at the heart of Boston.              “Brainstorming on my challenges with all these amazing brains deserves a shout-out every sprint”  (Jon, Member of our Machine learning team).          Most importantly, you'll have a huge impact, do important work, and work with a team of people you'll genuinely enjoy spending the day with.      DeepCure is an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to creating a workplace that is free of harassment and discrimination. We base our employment decisions on business needs, job requirements, and qualifications — that's all. Anduril is a defense technology company, bringing Silicon Valley talent and funding to the defense sector. Our technology helps our customers solve their toughest challenges by enabling them to make better, more informed decisions in life-and-death situations. We’ve assembled a diverse team of experts in artificial intelligence, computer vision, sensor fusion, optics, and data analysis that are creating software and hardware solutions to radically evolve the capabilities of the United States and our allies. We are extraordinary problem solvers, teammates, get-stuff-done-ers, and people who care deeply about our work. If you are passionate about solving problems that have real impact, come join Anduril and build the future of defense.                           About the role:             Anduril Imaging team develops state-of-the-art imaging systems, deployed to tackle the most significant security challenges of America and its allies. Our hemispherical infra-red system, WISP, is deployed for detection and tracking of objects in the air, on land and on the sea. We are looking for a Senior Algorithms Engineer to develop algorithms which will push the out boundary of performance of WISP and our other imaging systems in all environments. You will be responsible for maintaining a deep understanding our unique sensors, and designing, testing and deploying image processing algorithms which help utilize these sensors to their greatest ability.                    WHAT YOU'll DO             Work on challenging problems in a fast-paced environment across mission areas  Develop cutting-edge image processing techniques for signal improvement, detection, and tracking on high bit-depth, large format sensors  Work with mission operations, hardware, software teams to understand and evaluate current system performance  Establish engineering completion criteria and evaluation metrics for system performance, building tools for unit and integration tests                          REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS             B.S., M.S. Or PhD in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related discipline  Focus on image processing, computer vision, or machine learning  Strong analytical & critical thinking and problem-solving skills and an ability to communicate ideas clearly  Team-player, self-motivated, driven, organized  Strong background in software development  Experience troubleshooting and analyzing remotely deployed software systems  Experience with software revision control  Must be able to obtain and maintain a Top Secret level DoD security clearance                         Anduril is an equal-opportunity employer, and we encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you are someone passionate to work on problems that matter, we’d love to hear from you!

We are looking for a motivated individual to join our team, learn new technology, and help us build some great software!     Geisel Software develops web, mobile and embedded software, with a focus on robotics, medical devices, and machine learning. We seek a talented individual who is not afraid to work hard, learn something new and get lots of stuff done. We have a helpful staff, but it is also important that you can work independently and solve problems with little outside direction. Your problem-solving skills will be put to the test, whether that means tracking down the answer on Google, or building your own new solution. An aptitude for learning new platforms and technologies on the fly. We’re constantly working on new projects that will push you and keep you always learning new technologies.      Able to take ownership of a project and independently architect, execute and troubleshoot it through completion and customer delivery.      Actively pursuing new knowledge and technologies. You can be a Windows/Mac pro, but you'll be doing at least 50% of your development on Linux. You should be comfortable with that.      Willing to commute to Worcester, MA.      Looking for full-time employment.        What you’ll get         An opportunity to work with the latest technologies across a variety of platforms. job_title: Senior Director of AI & Machine Learning
job_Description: POSITION SUMMARY:        Under the direct supervision of the Chief of Analytics Officer, the Senior Director leads the research and development of new analytical methodologies, guides the implementation of the technologies for big data analysis, and interfaces the collaboration with external partners. The Senior Director works independently on the execution of corporate objectives, actively participates in internal program-specific development teams, external client engagements, and vendor management. The Senior Director is responsible for overseeing the development and execution of Data Analysis projects for BERG R&D groups, Clinical Trials, and external collaborations. Partnering with BERG IT s/he administrates the delivery of top-notch technologies within BERG HPC infrastructure. In addition, the position works close to BERG management to leverage key outputs and conclusions from BERG datastore        ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:            Work closely with R&D and Precision Medicine teams to provide expertise on data generation, curation, and implementation of program-specific analytical strategies      Integrate activities with R&D Biology and Precision Medicine/Diagnostic Teams      Identify project-specific data sources for easy consumption by R&D Biology and Precision Medicine initiatives      Continuous evaluation of cutting edge innovation in data analytics for program-specific and/or company-wide implementation      Leverage the diversity of internal and external molecular, clinical and other relevant data sources to help augment the company’s vision as a leader in the use of data-driven decisions in health can disease management      Develop a clear strategy for data ingestion, preparation, consumption strategy, framework, and operations      Supervise and support BERG Analytics team within their development and analytical tasks      Recruit, mentor, and evaluate members of the Analytics team, in addition to assuring their compliance with BERG policies and procedures      Ensure the optimal flow of BERG Analytics activities, responsibility for their timely delivery, and high-quality outputs      Lead the development and implementation of innovative solutions that support BERG Analytics internal and external projects      Internalize the streamlining and automation of BERG Analytics algorithms and activities      Understand BERG R&D challenges and hence implement analytical solutions that better fit R&D goals      Lead the deployment of Analytical tools into the web environment      Hands-on analysis of projects that challenge the standard analytical methods      Supervise the administration of BERG HPC environment, and research/propose the deployment of new technologies when necessary      Actively engage potential customers and support business development for BERG Analytics      Work in parallel with BERG management in driving BERG Analytics business objectives      Presentation of scientific results and activities internally and externally.      Preparation and submission of scientific manuscripts for review and publication      Other duties as assigned.           QUALIFICATIONS:         Requires a Ph.D. in Computational Biology or related field with 10+ years experience including 5+ years in the industry. A minimum of 5 years of team management and supervising experience is also required.      Proven ability to find creative and practical solutions to complex problems.      Proven experience in managing and delivering actionable solutions to internal and external collaborators      Strong understanding of molecular and clinical data      Ability to deliver outputs in a comprehensive format that highlights major trends, avoid miss-interpretations and value the conclusions      Demonstrated planning and project management skills.      Proficiency in R is required      Proficiency in Scala, C, Python, and MySQL is a plus      Solid experience in Linux and Big Data technologies      Working experience in AWS is a plus      Working knowledge of JavaScript, CSS, and HTML      Working knowledge of version control and project management systems      Excellent communication and interpersonal skills combined with a superior and proven track record of technical and organizational skills.      Must be able to work in a team-oriented environment and demonstrate attention to detail and record-keeping.

job_title: Principal Tech Program Mgr., Amazon Health
job_Description: 7+ years of experience working directly with engineering teams     Experience managing projects across cross functional teams, building sustainable processes and coordinating release schedules     5+ years of technical program management experience     7+ years of experience with software development lifecycle from conception to delivery     Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent professional experience     Excellent program management skills.     Excellent oral and written communication skills.     Excellent ability to coordinate and contribute to the design of systems within program space to include limitations, scaling, boundary conditions, and architectural decision making process     Job summary   We are looking for a highly motivated, Principal Technical Program Manager with both business and technical acumen to work on Amazon Health. You will have the opportunity to engage with an experienced cross-disciplinary staff to conceive of and design innovative consumer products. You thrive through building consensus and driving teams towards results. You will anticipate bottlenecks, provide escalation management, anticipate and make tradeoffs, and balance the business needs versus technical constraints. An ability to take large, complex projects and break them down into manageable pieces, develop functional specifications, then deliver them in a successful and timely manner is expected. Maturity, high judgment, negotiation skills, ability to influence, analytical talent and leadership are essential to success in this role.      The right candidate will possess proven program management skills, will demonstrate experience leading medium to large products and projects. You are expected to be versatile and able to thrive in a dynamic, entrepreneurial environment. You are not hindered by managing competing priorities and are able to bring order to ambiguous scenarios. Maturity, high judgment, negotiation skills, ability to influence and leadership are essential to success in this role. You will be data-driven and analytical. You can clearly & effectively communicate (written as well as verbally) across the org and up to senior leadership.      If you enjoy dealing with high ambiguity, complexity and broad scope that will be at the epicenter of our initiative, come join us!      About the team   Amazon’s mission is to make it dramatically easier for customers to access the healthcare products and services they need to get and stay healthy. Towards this mission, we are building the technology, products and services, that help customers find, buy, and engage with the healthcare solutions they need.            MS in Computer Science, Mathematics or a related field and/or 5+ years software development experience     Expertise in recommender systems and/or machine learning     Experience working with extremely large datasets     Experience in a startup environment     Experience in Healthcare     Creative leader with proven ability to tackle ambiguity     Excellent verbal and written communication skills and ability to engage technical and non-technical stakeholders     Strong problem solving and communication skills to earn trust and influence partners and teams, and demonstrate on time delivery     Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. At Tive we imagine a world fully transparent, where everything and everyone is connected. We want to pioneer beyond what the world thought possible so what others hold near and dear arrives on time and in full.                  We believe and live four core company values:              1. Create transparency first, everything else second : We believe the strongest trust belongs to those who are transparent, open and deliver on their word.              2. Make it simple:  We expect to do the work and deliver technical solutions to complex problems, simply.              3. At Tive, we’ve got your back : We hold fierce loyalty to our people.              4. Relentless iteration to find a better way : Our energy to learn new things and create solutions every day is unmatched anywhere in the world.                  Tive exists to solve the real time visibility challenges related to one of the world’s largest and most complex networks: global logistics and supply chain. Our team is focused on giving our customers the most access to accurate, live, and meaningful information about their shipments. Whether by road or rail, ocean or air, Tive is the most innovative and accurate way for companies to track their cargo.                  As a Data Scientist at Tive, you will use your considerable experience and industry knowledge to exceed customers' expectations while helping lead Tive into its next phase of growth.                            Our ideal candidate has:             Prior industry data science experience,  Strong problem solving and analytical skills with the ability to validate results and turn them into actionable business insights,  Experience with the entire life cycle of a data science project, from proof of concept development to production,  Strong Python and SQL skills,  Knowledge of a wide range of supervised and unsupervised algorithms,  Experience in a multi-dimensional data environment,  Hands on experience running ML algorithms in AWS or similar cloud technologies,  Excellent interpersonal and written/verbal communication skills,  Experience with geo-spatial and/or time series data,  Experience working with large, streaming datasets,  Familiarity with Agile development methodologies such as Scrum,  Prior experience building forecasting models from multivariate data,  Bayesian analysis skills, and  An advanced degree or work experience equivalent in computer science/mathematics/physics or related technical field.                                  What you'll be doing:             You will use the massive geo-spatial data sets that Tive collects every day, and turn them into actionable insights for our customers.  You will use machine learning and statistics, and build predictive models aimed at ensuring that every shipment sent with Tive arrives on time and in full.  You will use your relationship skills to build and strengthen cross functional relationships, including those with remote workers in other time zones.  You will be working with a world class team at a fast growing company that aims to make this the best place you’ve ever worked.                                 We celebrate diversity and consider it key to our success as a team and a company. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment of mutual respect for all employees.

In this age of disruption, organizations need to navigate the future with confidence by tapping into the power of data analytics, robotics, and cognitive technologies such as Artificial Intelligence (AI). Our Strategy & Analytics portfolio helps clients leverage rigorous analytical capabilities and a pragmatic mindset to solve the most complex of problems. By joining our team, you will play a key role in helping to our clients uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data and transforming the Government and Public Services marketplace.            Work you'll do          Take lead on a project to set the vision for data architecture, integration, and migration            The team          Deloitte's Government and Public Services (GPS) practice - our people, ideas, technology and outcomes-is designed for impact. Serving federal, state, & local government clients as well as public higher education institutions, our team of over 15,000+ professionals brings fresh perspective to help clients anticipate disruption, reimagine the possible, and fulfill their mission promise.         The GPS Analytics and Cognitive (A&C) offering is responsible for developing advanced analytics products and applying data visualization and statistical programming tools to enterprise data in order to advance and enable the key mission outcomes for our clients. Our team supports all phases of analytic work product development, from the identification of key business questions through data collection and ETL, and from performing analyses and using a wide range of statistical, machine learning, and applied mathematical techniques to delivery insights to decision-makers. Our practitioners give special attention to the interplay between data and the business processes that produce it and the decision-makers that consume insights.            Qualifications          Required:                Bachelor's degree required                Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future                Previous experience working in a higher education setting                7+ years of experience in data architecture, warehousing, integration, migration                Knowledge of data tools such as Informatica, Mulesoft, Boomi         Preferred:            Experience managing teams      Previous consulting experience      Excellent communication skills - both written and spoken

job_title: Sr. Mechanical Engineer, Amazon Robotics MicroFulfillment
job_Description: BS / MS in Mechanical Engineering     SolidWorks or similar CAD experience and understanding of best practices for part design, assemblies and configuration management.     Thorough understanding and use of principals, theories and concepts in mechanical engineering and ability to apply them to product design.     Effective organizational skills and the ability to work well with teams.     Ability to effectively communicate concepts and write technical documents.     Experience evaluating design, performance and logistical tradeoffs for hardware systems.     Job summary   Amazon Robotics seeks a customer obsessed and innovative mechanical engineer to lead the designs for our next generation fulfillment solutions to enable ultra-fast delivery from small footprint sites.      Join our team if you're passionate about revolutionizing the way customers shop. We obsess over our customers to imagine and deliver creative new technology solutions built on a fleet of mobile robots, dynamic storage systems, and workstations with integrated computer vision and artificial intelligence. As we strive to be earth’s best employer, our team will focus on integrating new and advanced technologies that increase safety and ergonomics for those working with our robots. We analyze problems from end to end and look for ways to reduce waste and improve sustainability.      Based out of our Robotics Innovation Hub in Westborough, MA, our offices, labs, test floors, and manufacturing are all co-located in the greater Boston area. As a hardware development engineer you will be walking into the epicenter of robotics innovation for Amazon. Working on a collaborative team of exceptional and innovative engineers, you and your teammates will design the hardware, write the code, test, build and watch your innovations come to life every day.        As an Amazon Robotics Mechanical Engineer, you will:          Ideate, own, and execute on designing robotics hardware for our customers all over the globe     Get hands-on with our system, both in our labs and in the field through prototyping, functional testing, requirement validation, and engaging with user feedback     Collaborate with software engineers, machine learning scientists, operations, supply chain, deployment engineers, and more     Participate in and lead hardware design reviews, both highly detailed peer reviews and large audience design milestones     Coach and mentor engineers on the team to foster a supportive culture of collaboration and delivery to high standards of scalability and performance     Are you inspired by invention? Is problem solving through teamwork in your DNA? Do you like the idea of seeing how your work impacts the bigger picture? Answer yes to these questions and you'll fit right in here at Amazon Robotics. We are a smart team of doers who work passionately to apply cutting edge advances in robotics and software to solve real-world challenges that will transform our customers experiences in ways we can't even image yet. We invent new improvements every day.      Key job responsibilities         Working with an interdisciplinary team to execute product designs from concept to production including specification, design, prototyping, validation and testing     Solving structural and thermal analyses to support all phases of programs including development and production     Working with the Operations, Manufacturing, Supply Chain and Quality organizations as well as vendors to ensure a smooth product launch and sustaining     Writing functional specifications, design verification plans, and functional test procedures     Exhibit role model behaviors of thorough engineering analysis and cradle to grave ownership     Design and adaptation of robotics solutions for ambiguous problems with fluid requirements     About the team   Inclusive Team Culture   We are intentional about attracting, developing, and retaining talent from diverse backgrounds. Our team has high standards not only for technical output but also for inclusive, collaborative problem solving.      Mentorship & Career Growth   Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, design reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member grow towards their career goals.            Experience with any of the following: robotics, automation, complex mechatronics.     Experience designing parts for medium volume manufacturing methods including any of the following: CNC machining, sheet metal, casting, and injection molding.     Exposure or training in ANSI Y-14.5 GD&T.     Proficiency with Product Lifecycle Management PLM software and ECO’s     Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. About Generate Biomedicines  Generate Biomedicines is a new kind of therapeutics company – existing at the intersection of machine learning, biological engineering, and medicine – pioneering Generative Biology™ to create breakthrough medicines where novel therapeutics are computationally generated, instead of being discovered. Generate has built a machine learning-powered biomedicines platform with the potential to generate new drugs across a wide range of biologic modalities. This platform represents a potentially fundamental shift in what is possible in the field of biotherapeutic development.  We pursue this audacious vision because we believe in the unique and revolutionary power of generative biology to radically transform the lives of billions, with an outsized opportunity for patients in need. We are seeking collaborative, relentless problem solvers that share our passion for impact to join us!  Generate was founded in 2018 by Flagship Pioneering and has received over $420 million in funding, providing the resources to rapidly scale the organization. The Company has offices in Cambridge, Somerville, and Andover with approximately 150 employees.  Position Summary  We are seeking a creative, motivated Software Engineer to help build our data platform. Generate Biomedicines is an innovative platform company leveraging Machine Learning to design novel protein therapeutics. This role will be an integral part of building a powerful, integrated data platform that streamlines data flow between wet and dry lab functions. The successful candidate will work closely with scientists from across the organization to understand both platform and project requirements, and translate those into high-quality software that rapidly advances our scientific programs.  Key Responsibilities:   Design and build web-based tools that enable experiment design and execution, capture results, and manage lab data  Design and develop data models to support lab workflows  Contribute to platform data architecture to ensure data flows smoothly between organizational groups  Work with lab and computational scientists to identify needs and opportunities for platform improvement  Integrate third party applications, such as ELN, into the data platform  Integrate automation robots with the data platform for high-throughput processes  Lead development efforts, manage/mentor junior software engineers   Qualifications:   Bachelor's or Master's in Computer Science, Data Science, or related field plus 5+ years of experience is required. Masters preferred  Demonstrated proficiency in Javascript/Typescript web development, and experience using a modern MV(C/VM) framework  Demonstrated proficiency in SQL  Demonstrated understanding of data management best practices and biological data  Self-motivated and curious with strong desire to both learn from and teach others  Outstanding communications and interpersonal skills  Proficiency in Python and/or Java a plus  Experience with AWS a plus   Work schedule:   We are open to a flexible work schedule or fully remote   Flagship Pioneering and our ecosystem companies are  committed to equal employment opportunity  regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.  COVID Safety:  Generate Biomedicines enforces a mandatory vaccination policy for COVID-19. All employees must be fully vaccinated and have received a booster. The purpose of this policy is to safeguard the health of our employees, their families, and the community at large from infectious disease that may be reduced by vaccinations. The company will make exceptions to this policy if required by applicable law and will consider requests for an exemption from this policy due to a medical reason, or because of a sincerely held religious belief, or any other exemptions that may be recognized by applicable law.  Recruitment & Staffing Agencies : Flagship Pioneering and its affiliated Flagship Lab companies (collectively, "FSP") do not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than candidates. The submission of unsolicited resumes by recruitment or staffing agencies to FSP or its employees is strictly prohibited unless contacted directly by Flagship Pioneering's internal Talent Acquisition team. Any resume submitted by an agency in the absence of a signed agreement will automatically become the property of FSP, and FSP will not owe any referral or other fees with respect thereto.

job_title: Data Scientist, Computational Biology and Rx Creation
job_Description: We believe it’s possible to have a profound impact on bending the cost curve in healthcare by building a pipeline of innovative medicines and bringing them to market at dramatically lower prices.            Robert Forrester                 CXO                     EQRx believes responsibility can be revolutionary. Want to make a difference while advancing your career? Come join a team that is working towards our bold mission of developing innovative medicines at radically low prices to help people get the medicines they need.          TEAM       : Integrative Data Sciences               Who We Are:           We're a new kind of biotech, one with a bold mission to bring innovative new medicines at dramatically lower costs.               What You’ll Do:      As a key contributor in the building of a digitally native life sciences company, you will work to streamline the drug discovery process with modern data science by building scalable data systems and state-of-the-art computational tools. You’ll build systems that capture the complexities of drug discovery and molecular optimization and the underlying biology and chemistry. You will work with our talented software engineers to bring these tools into production, facilitating the development of insightful data products for our world-class experts in portfolio strategy and drug discovery. You’ll use your data scientific, biological, and chemical expertise to guide infrastructure design, ensuring a useful digital representation of the discovery process.           In your role you will evaluate, implement, and perfect a broad variety of computational methods for drug discovery, especially in biologicals, providing key insights on efficacy, generality, and relevance to EQRx technology development strategy. You’ll develop tools, techniques, and data products shaped by these insights, integrating these results into EQRx’s drug discovery, preclinical experimentation, clinical trialing, and strategic modeling workflows. You will be part of a larger Data Science and Engineering team that combines areas of expertise to gain a molecular understanding of disease etiology, to identify novel targets and chemical matter, assess preclinical model translation relevance and patient population heterogeneity.               The Impact You Will Have:       You will help us in our goal to radically lower drug prices and expand access, by integrating modern data science and computational techniques for rational antibody design into a rapid, state-of-the-art drug development process. You’ll drive the adoption of data products based on seamless, transparent, data and bioinformatic tools across a data-first life sciences company. You will enable experts across EQRx to see further, connecting data from biology to the clinic and patients, powering a novel paradigm in drug development.               Your Professional Superpowers:               You have 2+ years of experience in data science or computational biology in industry.       You have a Ph.D. (preferred) or Masters with additional experience in a quantitative scientific field such as chemistry, physics, computational biology, computer science, or engineering.       You are fluent in python (strongly preferred) or R and cloud-native data science from data extraction and organization to code sharing.       You have experience organizing biological and chemical information in rational, reusable schemas. Ideally, this includes experience with database design, and you can employ generalizable design approaches that are robust to new use cases and product requests.       You have deep experience in computational biology, having frequently implemented bioinformatic tools, and have a keen eye for automating repeatable workflows       Ideally, you have experience with the application of modern machine learning methods, with a focus on delivering tangible value instead of adding unnecessary complexity .       You have experience working with large biological databases (i.e., PDB, IEDB, IMGT, etc.), and understand how to leverage public data to enable team members to see further with data.       You are well practiced in SQL, and can construct complex queries to meet diverse business needs.       You think deeply about how to capture the complex hierarchy of biological information from sequence and structure to gene and pathway to clinical phenotype and present this to experts with diverse backgrounds.       You are an excellent communicator, able to translate complex analyses into insightful visuals and presentations for audiences with a wide range of technical backgrounds.       You are empathetic with end users; proficient at turning business and scientific questions into testable, clean, and reproducible data scientific workflows.       You have a quick, flexible mind and can rapidly learn new fields and use data science to improve decision making and workflows       You are an avid reader of the literature; excited to try novel tools and techniques to solve problems.       You can participate and work effectively on multiple cross-functional teams.       You play well in the sandbox. You understand relationships are key and have strong interpersonal skills.       Teams love working with you and you are someone who takes pride in mentoring and supporting the careers of others.       You’re a team player who is willing to roll-up your sleeves and get the job done.                    APPLY            Are you bold enough?      Your work should matter and allow you the freedom to be 100% you. We spend too much time and effort in our career to not feel excited and proud about what we do and who we do it with. In other words, your career is too important for your next move to be just another job, so let’s work together to change the world and bring affordable medicines to all patients.           We aren’t about a bunch of empty slogans on a wall or words on a coffee cup – you can find that in lots of places. We are a culture of individuals with diverse backgrounds and personalities.

We’re currently looking for smart, enthusiastic people who want to join our team of world-renowned researchers as we push the boundaries applying AI in support of human creativity. About Generate Biomedicines  Generate Biomedicines is a new kind of therapeutics company – existing at the intersection of machine learning, biological engineering, and medicine – pioneering Generative Biology™ to create breakthrough medicines where novel therapeutics are computationally generated, instead of being discovered. Generate has built a machine learning-powered biomedicines platform with the potential to generate new drugs across a wide range of biologic modalities. This platform represents a potentially fundamental shift in what is possible in the field of biotherapeutic development.  We pursue this audacious vision because we believe in the unique and revolutionary power of generative biology to radically transform the lives of billions, with an outsized opportunity for patients in need. We are seeking collaborative, relentless problem solvers that share our passion for impact to join us!  Generate was founded in 2018 by Flagship Pioneering and has received over $420 million in funding, providing the resources to rapidly scale the organization. The Company has offices in Cambridge, Somerville, and Andover with approximately 150 employees.  Position Summary:  We are seeking creative, curious, and resourceful team members who operate at the frontiers of engineering, biology, and drug discovery. This role would be responsible for crafting novel cell therapies and will have a substantial impact on the future success of Generate's pipeline of biomedicines. This is a hands-on, laboratory-based position with a large opportunity for creativity and influence towards the direction of a rapidly growing science and technology company.  Key Responsibilities:   Apply synthetic biology engineering approaches to enable machine learning-guided design of cell therapies like CAR-T, CAR-NK, and TCR-T  Contribute to the design of extremely large discovery libraries for novel CARs  Perform extremely large, multimodal, cell-based screening experiments  Develop cell culture models for screening engineered immune cells  Partner with data scientists and engineers to apply machine learning to the generation of synthetic receptors  Work in dynamic, diverse, project-based teams in a flat hierarchy  Actively contribute to the creation and development of new projects   Working at Generate, you would have access to world-leading technology platforms in the areas of:   Automated liquid handling and digital microfluidics  Droplet microfluidics for molecular and cell biology  High-throughput cell- and protein-based library generation and screening  Closed-loop machine learning/wetlab integration  Protein structure/function prediction and determination   Qualifications :  We have multiple openings and are interested in candidates at various experience levels.   Candidates with a bachelor's degree or master's degree will be considered  Experience working with mammalian cell culture required  Experience with high-throughput screening strongly preferred  Experience working with T cells or NK cells strongly preferred  Experience with gene editing preferred  Experience working with CARs or TCRs preferred  Experience in a lab automation environment preferred  High-throughput (HTS) library generation and screening experience strongly preferred  Familiarity with bioinformatic analyses with Python or R desired but not required  Ability to work in a dynamic, creative and fast-paced environment required  Strong collaboration and communication skills required   Flagship Pioneering and our ecosystem companies are  committed to equal employment opportunity  regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.  COVID Safety:  Generate Biomedicines enforces a mandatory vaccination policy for COVID-19. All employees must be fully vaccinated and have received a booster. The purpose of this policy is to safeguard the health of our employees, their families, and the community at large from infectious disease that may be reduced by vaccinations. The company will make exceptions to this policy if required by applicable law and will consider requests for an exemption from this policy due to a medical reason, or because of a sincerely held religious belief, or any other exemptions that may be recognized by applicable law.  Recruitment & Staffing Agencies : Flagship Pioneering and its affiliated Flagship Lab companies (collectively, "FSP") do not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than candidates. The submission of unsolicited resumes by recruitment or staffing agencies to FSP or its employees is strictly prohibited unless contacted directly by Flagship Pioneering's internal Talent Acquisition team. Any resume submitted by an agency in the absence of a signed agreement will automatically become the property of FSP, and FSP will not owe any referral or other fees with respect thereto.

Job Description:        The Role        The Healthcare Artificial Intelligence Center of Excellence is seeking an experienced and skilled Data Scientist to join our team. You will build an analytics product that helps our clients understand their benefit plans. You will work with both financial data and health insurance claims. The analysis you provide, analytics you develop, and business insights you deliver will drive our customers’ management of their benefits to new heights!        The Expertise and Skills You Bring         BS in statistics, econometrics, or similar quantitative field; MS and formal training in analytics is helpful      5+ years of experience delivering analytics through digital offerings, such as dashboards and self-service reports      Consistent record as an authority in analyzing insurance claims and financial data      Successfully led many projects that yielded insights about the healthcare industry      Demonstrated history conceptualizing, designing, and developing analyses, especially in population health      Prior roles include directly working with business partners      Fluent in SQL and Python; experience with AWS and big data platforms such as Snowflake is a plus      Deep knowledge of medical informatics, including diagnosis & procedural codes and episode groupers      Sound grasp of statistical methods, including hypothesis testing, trending, population segmentation; statistical models and inferring causal relationships are a plus      Versatile in visualization design, dashboard development and effective story telling using data, where knowledge of tools such as Tableau and Power BI is preferred      Proven track record to understand business needs and define what analyses would best inform business decisions      Comfortable leading several projects simultaneously, collaborating with business/technical groups and vendor      Empowering our clients to deliver great benefits to their employees, promoting health, financial security, and general well being      Building a fast-growing analytics business that addresses unmet needs in the marketplace      Fostering a culture of Measurements, Test & Learn, and Data-Driven Decision Making within the larger organization           The Team        Fidelity’s growing healthcare business services employees of our clients with offerings such as a benefits administration platform for selecting and handling their benefits as well as a health savings account product for saving for medical expenses. The Healthcare Artificial Intelligence Center of Excellence delivers internal digital tools, customer facing applications and insights from analytics by using a diverse set of healthcare and benefit related data sources. We employ a full spectrum of data science techniques - predictive models from machine learning, causal inference from epidemiology, and natural language processing from deep learning are all part of the mix. We open up the boundaries of what’s possible with data science to help clients and their employees select, handle, and navigate their healthcare benefits.        Certifications:        Company Overview      Fidelity Investments is a privately held company with a mission  to strengthen the financial well-being of our clients.  We help people invest and plan for their future. We assist companies and non-profit organizations in delivering benefits to their employees. And we provide institutions and independent advisors with investment and technology solutions to help invest their own clients’ money.         Join Us      At Fidelity, you’ll find endless opportunities to build a meaningful career that positively impacts peoples’ lives, including yours. You can take advantage of flexible benefits that support you through every stage of your career, empowering you to thrive at work and at home. Honored with a Glassdoor Employees’ Choice Award, we have been recognized by our employees as a Best Place to Work in 2022. And you don’t need a finance background to succeed at Fidelity—we offer a range of opportunities for learning so you can build the career you’ve always imagined.      As a result of COVID-19, many of our associates are continuing to work remotely. When Fidelity employees eventually return to the office, our goal is for most people to work flexibly in a way that balances both personal and business needs with time onsite and offsite through what we’re calling “Dynamic Working.”      We invite you to  Find Your Fidelity  at fidelitycareers.com.     Fidelity Investments is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that the most effective way to attract, develop and retain a diverse workforce is to build an enduring culture of inclusion and belonging.      Fidelity will reasonably accommodate applicants with disabilities who need adjustments to participate in the application or interview process. To initiate a request for an accommodation, contact the HR Leave of Absence/Accommodation Team by sending an email to accommodations @fmr.com, or by calling  800-835-5099 , prompt 2, option 2.

Shift Technology is a leader and innovator in the InsurTech industry transforming insurance with AI. We help insurers identify suspected fraud, money laundering, and fully automate more claims making internal teams more effective and improving financial performance.  Since our launch in 2014 at our corporate office in Paris, we've raised over $320M with Tier 1 investors, opened offices in Boston, Tokyo, Singapore, London, Madrid, Mexico, Hong-Kong, and Sao Paulo, and currently work with more than 80 of the world's leading insurers. If you are excited about joining a fast-growing InsurTech innovator with a passion for excellence and a global culture, Shift wants to hear for you!   About the Team   This role is part of our Data Science team which is the largest team in our organization consisting of over 140+ Data Scientists throughout the world.  Our Data Scientists work in a full lifecycle role and on a broad range of subjects acquiring extensive technical and professional experience in data science, data engineering, coding, business understanding and client engagement.  Our company is small enough that each person's achievements has an impact on our overall performance, yet big enough to be a world leader and innovator in our domain.  As a member of the data science team, you will be working alongside our technical experts and your role will be key to rolling out our enterprise level solutions to our clients.  Job Responsibilities  You will actively participate in the development of our suite of products: fraud detection, anti-money laundering, and claim automation; and working on various data types such as structured data, free text, documents and images.  Implementation of the data engineering , usually from client extracts to the insertion of the data in our data stores (SQL, ElasticSearch)  Developing, testing, tuning models and putting them in production  for tasks such as fraud detection and automation detection in complex environments.  Automate key business tasks  by implementing them in our production process framework in C#  Conduct meetings with clients  and interact with external stakeholders, whether it is for direct user feedback, presenting business cases or defining the roadmap of evolutions   WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR  We are looking for candidates with diverse skills to help us build excellent technology solutions for our clients and be proficient in the following skills:   Code-savvy , either by having a degree in computer science and/or having developed some apps with actual users- writing scripts for models and notebooks is not enough at Shift, we thrive on people who can write maintainable, production-quality code that will run everyday without breaking.  AI-savvy , either by having a degree in machine learning and/or statistics. Having a clear understanding of statistics and machine learning problems, tasks and common resolutions is important to communicate internally and explain to the client how the product is working.  Client facing . You will need to be comfortable and open to communicating to our clients on a regular basis  Business smart . We don't expect candidates to know the insurance sector, but we want applicants who are interested in learning and mastering the business aspects of our products  Fluent in English.  We are an international company with offices in many countries and 40+ nationalities, the Shift working language is English.    EEO Statement  At Shift we thrive to be a diverse and inclusive workforce. We hire and trust people without regard to race, color, religion, marital status, age, national or ethnic origin, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or other non-merit criteria. Shift is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.  Shift Technology does not accept unsolicited CVs from recruiters or employment agencies in response to the Shift Technology Careers page or a Shift Technology social media post. Shift Technology will not consider or agree to payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee relating to these unsolicited CVs. Shift Technology explicitly reserves the right to hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Any unsolicited CVs, including those submitted directly to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of Shift Technology.

Jerry, ranked by LinkedIn as one of       the Top 50 technology startups      , is expanding our data team!                   Here at Jerry, we think owning a car should be as easy as taking a drive.              The Data and Analytics (DNA) team owns data at Jerry and drives intelligent business decision-making through analytical insights and advanced models. The DNA team is seeking an exemplary data scientist to accelerate the company’s continuous growth and take its customer experience to the next level. As a senior data scientist, you bring your expertise in product and user analytics to Jerry. You will lead the design and development of A/B tests and analytical models to understand user experience and drive feature and design decisions. You will join a team of data engineers, data analysts, and data scientists. We are passionate about our mission to build a car ownership super app. We work hard and we also like to have fun.                  RESPONSIBILITIES              - Lead the design and development of A/B tests on app features and user experience             - Produce research projects to recommend business strategies             - Define data science standards and best practices and drive operational excellence             - Partner with product managers to advise product decisions             - Partner with and mentor data analysts to build reports and visualization             - Partner with other data scientists to evolve, optimize and integrate machine learning models                  BASIC QUALIFICATIONS              - Master’s degree in a highly quantitative field (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Operational Research, Machine Learning, etc.)             - 5+ years of experience as a data scientist or in a similar role             - 3+ years of experience with scripting languages (Python, Java, etc.) or statistical packages (R, SAS, Matlab, etc.)             - Hands-on experience with SQL             - Proven experience in designing and implementing A/B tests and other user research             - Proven ability in effective verbal and written communication to technical peers and leadership teams with various degrees of technical knowledge                  PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS              - Doctoral degree in a highly quantitative field (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Operational Research, Machine Learning, etc.)             - 5+ years of experience as a data scientist with a consumer-facing technology company             - 3+ years of experience as a data scientist working on user acquisition and retention initiatives             - Experience with web and app user experience analysis             - 3+ years of experience working on machine learning models             - Experience in analytical and visualization platforms (Tableau, Qlik, Power BI, etc.)             - Experience providing technical leadership and mentorship                            About Jerry:                   Jerry is building the first Super App to save car owners time and money on all their car expenses. Drivers deserve better. That’s why we’re committed to making shopping for insurance, financing, maintenance, repairs, parking and more just a few clicks, texts, or swipes away.                  Jerry is taking processes that haven’t substantively changed in decades and reimagining and redesigning them. Using artificial intelligence, machine learning and bots, Jerry eliminates the need for long forms and phone calls while providing personalized services for all car-owners’ needs.                  Today, Jerry is the #1 rated and most downloaded app in its category and the fastest way to compare and buy car insurance. We have more than 1M customers and we are just getting started. Join our team of curious and passionate people who love tackling real-world problems and be a part of building a revolutionary product that’s disrupting a massive market.                  Jerry was founded in 2017 by serial entrepreneurs and has raised more than $130 million in financing.

About Optimus Ride             Optimus Ride is an autonomous mobility service provider on a mission to drive the future of transportation. We develop and own the full AV tech stack and user experience–algorithms, software, hardware, and system integration–for autonomous, electric rides for communities near and far. We’re focused on driving innovation and delivering convenient, turnkey transportation services for master planned communities, corporate and academic campuses, and mixed use developments. We’re driven to create safe, sustainable, and equitable transportation solutions for all.                  Optimus Ride is headquartered in the Boston Seaport District, not far from our old stomping ground at MIT. From the boardroom to the test track, our teammates (affectionately referred to as Optimists) bring deep industry and subject matter expertise, a collaborative and focused work ethic, and an optimistic outlook on the future of autonomous, sustainable, community-serving transportation.                  The Role             Optimus Ride software engineers create the software at the heart of our vehicles and systems. Our software needs to process complex dataflows and make decisions with real world consequences. We are looking for experienced technical leaders and managers to lead the perception team, and who bring deep expertise in enabling vehicles and robots to perceive and understand the world around them.                  Our team is focused on a rapid path to market in order to maximize the benefits of self-driving technologies for all. To do this, we need our engineers to be versatile, have leadership qualities, and be enthusiastic about tackling problems across the full range of our systems. Your peers will cumulatively have decades of experience from places like Google X, SpaceX, iRobot, Rethink Robotics, and Draper Laboratories, and have built self-driving vehicles, electric vehicles, manufacturing robots, surgical robots, autonomous drones, and more. You will be creating new technologies through software development that integrates your areas of expertise to enable self-driving systems to be possible today.                    Responsibilities             Build software for self-driving cars by leading, managing, and growing a team of perception engineers and scientists  Create advanced perception systems to enable the vehicle to accurately perceive and react to its surrounding environment  Take responsibility for the overall planning, execution and success of complex technical projects  Provide the team with technical leadership and contribute technically to projects  Work closely with other teams, especially within engineering and product development                          Requirements             BS, MS or PhD in computer science or a related field, or equivalent practical experience  Significant hands-on technical leadership and engineering management experience in the Robotics/Autonomous Vehicle space.  Deep expertise with topics such as computer vision, point cloud processing, machine learning, sensor fusion, and real-time perception  Track record of delivering complex technical projects  Excellent communication skills in written and verbal English                                  Bonus             Significant experience writing production quality C++ code  Experience with robotics and AI applications (self-driving cars, real-time hardware-software systems, etc)  Experience with one or more of: GPU programming, state estimation, real-time systems, mapping and localization, machine learning, neural networks, object detection and tracking                         Benefits and Working Environment             At Optimus Ride, we strive to support our employees by offering competitive compensation, comprehensive benefits and a world class working environment that is centered around the team. We nurture creativity and provide expansive opportunities for growth and development.                  Optimus Ride provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

(with relevant experience) level researcher with degree in Computer Science, Theoretical Biophysics, or Computational Biology wanted for bioinformatics/chemometrics algorithm development. Will also consider exceptional candidates from Physics, Theoretical Chemistry, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, or Electrical Engineering. Cognitive Systems Engineer  At MORSE, we solve hard problems to field innovative technology to our customers in the US Department of Defense and the Intelligence Community. We are a company of smart people, who are easy to work with and passionate about making an impact for national security. Our work spans UAVs with precision delivery, novel AI capabilities, Test and Evaluation to make sure the AI solutions accomplish their intended missions, and advanced Decision Systems to arm the warfighter with data to make better, faster decisions to plan missions and have situational awareness into potential threats.  Job Summary  As a Cognitive Systems/HF Engineer, you will work with end users and stakeholders to assess the operational effectiveness and performance of Artificial Intelligence (AI) systems. As we perform Operational Test & Evaluation (OT&E), you will lead user engagement and knowledge elicitation studies to understand user requirements and define metrics to assess the effectiveness of Human-AI teaming in operational environments. You will use your knowledge of iterative design processes to regularly elicit feedback regarding the human-AI teaming experience to recommend best practices, including design mock-ups, for enhancing the user's operational effectiveness. You will also use your advanced data analysis skills to evaluate human-AI performance under different operational conditions to tailor AI technical solutions for specific operational scenarios and tempos.  Responsibilities   Perform Operational Test and Evaluation (OT&E) of Artificial Intelligence   Lead user engagement studies, knowledge elicitation sessions, human-in-the-loop assessments, and workflow analysis   Identify appropriate human performance metrics to evaluate the system performance and effectiveness of Human-AI Teaming   Perform quantitative and qualitative assessments of human performance with AI systems   Develop UI mockups   Liaison between data scientists, software developers, analysts and end users   Perform descriptive and inferential statistics to characterize human performance   Be familiar with a wide range of metrics to assess signal detection from a human performance as well as a machine-learning perspective   Skills and Requirements   US CITIZENSHIP REQUIRED and ability to obtain a U.S. Security Clearance   MS or PhD in Cognitive Psychology, Psychology, User Experience, Human Factors, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, or other related field   Experience with HMT, HMI, HSI, Human Factors, Human Performance, and Usability   Experience engaging with end users and stakeholders   Programming in Python, R, and MATLAB   We are employee-owned, meaning all of our staff are shareholders and we have no outside investors, so we focus on what is best for our customers and our team. We pursue steady, long-term success while maintaining a collaborative, enjoyable work experience for our employees. Our team values work-life balance through flexibility, a hybrid work environment, and comprehensive benefits package for employees and families. For more information, please visit www.morsecorp.com.

Minimum qualifications:          PhD in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Electrical Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience      Experience in machine learning and deep learning using modern machine learning packages (e.g. TensorFlow)      Experience in one or more of the following languages: Python, C/C++, Java        Preferred qualifications:          Industry experience in end-to-end system building, deploying, and maintaining ML models in production      Experience with transfer learning and semi-supervised/unsupervised learning      Experience in signal processing and filtering techniques for biosignals (e.g., PPG, ECG, audio)      Experience with embedded devices and sensors      Solid understanding of human physiology      Interpersonal and communication skills            About the job      Your mission will be to develop AI-driven health sensing technology and applications that leverage the global ubiquity of smartphones to make a meaningful difference to people’s health and wellness.      Mobile-based health sensing is one of the main thrusts of the broader Consumer Health Research team, which spans from Fitbit and Google Health AI Research. As a Research Scientist, you'll apply machine learning in ways to advance health sensing technology and improve human health.      Google Health has made major advances in healthcare research, such as detecting eye disease more quickly and accurately than experts, planning cancer radiotherapy treatment in seconds rather than hours, and working to detect patient deterioration before it happens with electronic records.       Fundamental research is at the core of Google Health - the multidisciplinary team collaborates with partners to publish novel research in renowned scientific journals. They then work to apply this research into the medical field through clinical hardware and products developed in Google. Working alongside colleagues across Google, you’ll help make this vision a reality.            Responsibilities           Design, implement, and validate new machine learning models/algorithms for novel sensing applications in healthcare.       Create data pipelines, modeling, evaluation, and analysis platforms to transform research prototypes to production models for deployment. Optimize models to ensure generalization in real-world deployment and equity in performance.       Work cross-functionally with clinical, biostatistics, and product to design clinical validation studies.       Create software artifacts and documents. Publish in scientific journals and/or conferences.       Scope and surface new areas for novel exploration related to AI in healthcare.
