job_title: Principal Scientist - Membrane Protein Structural Biologist
job_Description: Make your mark for patients. We’re here because we want to build the future and transform patients’ lives for the better. At UCB, our people are our experiences and achievements, our passion and drive. That’s why we’re looking for talented individuals with diverse backgrounds and experiences - not just the best and brightest, but those who care about making a meaningful difference in the lives of patients. We promote an environment of diversity, openness, and respect where people can make valuable contributions. An exciting journey lies ahead. Will you join us in pushing the boundaries of what’s possible? To strengthen our Structural Biology department, we are seeking a creative and dynamic laboratory-based  Principal Scientist  for execution of  membrane protein structural biology  to support diverse drug discovery programs. This position will be based at our Boston R&D Hub in Cambridge, MA. Major Accountabilities: Execute all aspects of membrane protein drug discovery projects including expression construct design, protein production, biochemical and biophysical analysis, hit finding, and structural biology Determine 3D structures using state-of-the-art techniques (e.g., X-ray or CryoEM) Apply biophysical methods for membrane protein characterization, including small-molecule binding Work closely with project team members, protein production teams, and other structural biologists across UCB research sites (including Seattle WA USA, Slough UK, and Braine-l’Alleud Belgium) to successfully progress drug discovery projects under aggressive timelines and impact UCB’s drug discovery programs and patients’ lives. Adhere to industry standards of laboratory technique to ensure experimental integrity, including careful documentation of results in electronic laboratory notebooks. Requirements: PhD in applicable field (biochemistry, chemistry, molecular & cellular biology, etc.) 5+ years relevant industry experience or BS and 15 plus years of relevant industry experience. 5+ years of membrane protein experience, including expression and purification, biochemical analysis, biophysical characterization using biophysical methods, and high-resolution structural biology methods Competencies: Ability to succeed in a face-paced, results-driven environment. High attention to detail and excellent organizational skills. Self-motivation and the ability to thrive in a multidisciplinary team environment. Excellent communications and interpersonal skills. CryoEM experience on membrane proteins (e.g. ion channels or GPCRs) Experience in the use of computational workflows (Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning) in discovery of therapeutics Working knowledge of small molecule drug discovery efforts Experience with antibody discovery against membrane proteins Previous supervisory experience of direct reports About us: At UCB, we come together every day to work, laser-focused, on a simple question: How will this create value for people living with severe diseases? By putting patients at the heart of everything we do, our approach – from discovery to development to delivery – is continuously transformed and designed around patient needs and their journey. With a team of approximately 8,000 employees and worldwide operations in more than 40 countries, we are a global biopharmaceutical company investing more than a quarter of our revenue in cutting-edge scientific research. We are focused on addressing chronic, neurological, immunological, and bone diseases. We are looking for people with passion and empathy who develop a real understanding of patient’s needs and can deliver thoughtful solutions to decisionmakers across the health care ecosystem. The Company is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, gender, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other characteristic protected by law. Where permitted, applicants for employment in the United States must either have received or been willing to receive a full COVID-19 vaccination by the date of hire; or, alternatively, agree to be subject to weekly COVID-19 testing, subject to religious and medical exemptions and in accordance with applicable law.

job_title: Associate Director, Statistical Programming Early Phase
job_Description: Some opportunities happen only once in a lifetime - like a job where you have the chance to change lives. At Alexion, people living with rare and devastating diseases are our Guiding Star. We are driven to continuously innovate and create meaningful value in all we do to help patients and families fully live their best lives. We value the uniqueness and diversity of our employees and recognize that nurturing the diverse perspectives and strengths of our people translates into innovative breakthroughs for patients.   This is what you will do:  The Associate Director of Statistical Programming Data Standards & Governance will be primarily responsible for assisting in establishing and driving data standards & Governance strategy of Alexion’s Global standards for the Study Data Tabulation Model (SDTM), the Analysis of Data Model (ADaM), controlled terminology (CT), the data definition files (Define.xml), and any other components needed for submission to regulatory agencies such as FDA and PMDA. Additionally, this person will be responsible for expert review of Statistical Programming submission deliverables to ensure compliance with external regulatory requirements. He/she will serve as an expert consultant to Statistical Programming team on matters related to data standards. He/she will use his/her leadership skills to lead one or more internal working groups related to data standards. He/she will also help in driving development of Alexion's therapeutic area standards for one or more therapeutic area.   You will be responsible for:  Assist in driving strategy for development, maintenance, implementation, and management of SDTM and ADaM standards globally, across therapeutic areas, and across protocols. Including, but not limited to: SDTM metadata, compliance checks, controlled terminology, and data define files. ADaM metadata, compliance checks, controlled terminology, and define files.  Manage versions of standards. Perform and communicate impact analysis results.  Responsible for governance of standards to ensure proper utilization of standards and adherence to standard procedures. Provide secondary reviews of Statistical Programming deliverables to ensure compliance with external regulatory requirements for submission of standardized data. Lead one or more internal cross-functional working groups for data standards. Drive development of Alexion's therapeutic area standards for one or more therapeutic areas.  Collaborate cross-functionally to maximize harmonization of standards across various standards (e.g. Data collection and SDTM standards).  Act as an SME and administrator of validation software for standardized data (e.g. Pinnacle 21). Lead or help with implementation of standards metadata repository. Provide training to internal staff on various data standards topics. Participate and influence at industry level standards forums (e.g. CDISC, PhUSE etc.). Any other activities as required.  The duties of this role are generally conducted in an office environment. As is typical of an office-based role, employees must be able, with or without an accommodation to: use a computer; engage in communications via phone, video, and electronic messaging; problem solve; engage in complex and non-linear thought, analysis, and dialogue; collaborate with others; maintain general availability during standard business hours.   You will need to have:  10+ years Clinical/statistical programming and/or clinical data standards experience in the CRO or Pharmaceutical Industry. Strong knowledge of CDISC standards such as CDASH, SDTM, ADaM, and Define-XML. Practical experience for development, maintenance, and implementation of standards libraries. Practical experience with validation software for standardized data (e.g. Pinnacle 21).  Practical experience of leading data standards initiatives (internal or external). Knowledge of or experience with standards metadata repository. 2-5 years people and/or project management experience in the CRO or Pharmaceutical Industry.  Proven abilities to lead and manage cross-functional projects, and people, from concept to completion.  Strong verbal and written communication skills - ability to clearly and effectively present information.  Knowledge of SAS Programming language. Knowledge of: Good Clinical Practices. Good Programming Practices. 21CFR Part 11 Standards. Integrated Summary Safety/Efficacy Analyses. Safety data and Coding Dictionaries (MedDRA and WHODD).  Creating all files necessary to support an electronic submission in the eCTD format. BS/MS/MA in Statistics, Biostatistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or related area.   #LI-MH1   Alexion is a global biopharmaceutical company focused on serving patients and families affected by rare diseases and devastating conditions through the discovery, development and commercialization of life-changing medicines. Headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, Alexion has offices around the globe and serves patients in more than 50 countries. Further information about Alexion can be found at: www.alexion.com.   Alexion is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We are committed to fostering a culture of belonging where every single person can belong because of their uniqueness. The Company will not make decisions about employment, training, compensation, promotion, and other terms and conditions of employment based on race, color, religion, creed or lack thereof, sex, sexual orientation, age, ancestry, national origin, ethnicity, citizenship status, marital status, pregnancy, (including childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), parental status (including adoption or surrogacy), military status, protected veteran status, disability, medical condition, gender identity or expression, genetic information, mental illness or other characteristics protected by law. Alexion has taken critical steps to protect colleagues, loved ones, and patients from COVID-19 and its variants. All US-based employees must comply with Alexion's COVID-19 vaccination mandate. Alexion provides exceptions based on applicable state law as well as reasonable accommodations to meet the needs of candidates and employees. To begin an interactive dialogue with Alexion regarding a legally required exemption or accommodation, please contact accommodations@Alexion.com. Alexion participates in E-Verify.   As a leading employer in our industry, Alexion offers a highly competitive package of base and incentive compensation as well as a comprehensive benefits program designed to support the health, wellness and financial security of our employees and their families. Benefits include group medical, vision and dental coverage, group and supplemental life insurance, 401(k) with company match, tuition reimbursement, and much more.   AstraZeneca completed its acquisition of Alexion, marking the creation of Alexion, AstraZeneca Rare Disease. If you're interested in career opportunities with AstraZeneca, click here.

Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect.  DIGITAL HEALTHCARE (DHC) SYSTEMS APPLIED DATA SCIENTIST/ENGINEER (EXPERIENCED) (WILM)  Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect.  DHC Systems Applied Data Engineer  The growth and demand for health monitoring has and will continue to grow exponentially. ADI is well positioned to leverage its core sensor and signal processing technology to take advantage of this growth. We are looking for an energetic Applied Data Engineer who can couple the advanced technologies being developed at ADI to the physiological challenges being presented by the clinical market to develop systems for bio/medical applications.  The candidate:  Will develop digital signal processing techniques and AI algorithms with applications specific to medical devices including, but not limited to vital signs monitoring (VSM) consists of optical sensing systems (PPG), IMUs, biopotential (ECG, EMG, EEG), and bioimpedance (EDA, thoracic impedance, ICG, etc.), and thermal sensors.  Work with large, complex medical data sets. Solve difficult analysis problems, handling data challenges from a real-world clinical setting  Develop quality control and pre-processing tools for a broad range of digital and clinical data types.  Iterate on key features and build new statistical and machine learning models relating measured features to clinical endpoints.  Collaborate with other data science teams within ADI to share best practices and efficient use of data and tools  Mentor a growing team of data scientists supporting the full lifecycle of Data Science activities  Stay abreast of state-of-the-art algorithmes, and research advances beyond the state of the art in areas relevant to Analog Devices.  Should understand interactions between human physiology and both electrical and mechanical engineering as well as the different mechanisms involved in these interactions. Will interface with design, test, application, software and marketing teams as the product(s) move from design to completion and distribution.  Will support customers with the customer’s platform and resolve algorithm-specific issues.  Minimum Qualifications:  MS/PhD in Electrical or Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or similar  5+ years of experience in data engineering/cloud, data analytics  Fluency in Python, and Matlab programming skills, familiar with C/C++, AWS technology  Experience working with large data sets for algorithm development  Experience with exploratory and statistical data analysis (such as linear models, multivariate analysis, predictive modeling and stochastic models).  Experience with software engineering practices and developing data pipelines.  Hands on experience on algorithm development and machine learning, deep neural networks Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities  Experience with defect tracking tools (Jira, SVN, etc.)  Strong communication skills as they will be developing requirements and design documents  Preferred Qualifications:  Experience with analysis of EHR/claim data.  Experience with enrollment, engagement, or digital analytics.  Experience working with cloud computing and database systems  Willingness to learn and work end-to-end, from analysis/modeling to production software.  #LI-AC1  For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. As such, applicants for this position – except US Citizens, US Permanent Residents, and protected individuals as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3) – may have to go through an export licensing review process.  Analog Devices, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Females/Vet/Disability  EEO is the Law: Notice of Applicant Rights Under the Law  Education Level : Master's Degree  Travel Required : Yes, 25% of the Time

job_title: Senior Software Engineer, Modeling and Simulation
job_Description: Our mission at Asimov is to radically advance humankind's ability to design living systems. We're developing a mammalian synthetic biology platform––from cells to software––to enable biotechnologies with outsized impact, with an initial focus on gene therapies, cell therapies, and protein therapeutics.                  We’re creating a state-of-the-art platform to program living cells that allows bioengineers to design, build, and debug genetic systems at scale and in the context of industrial bioprocesses. We’re seeking a software engineer with scientific computing and applied mathematics experience to build a framework for ubiquitous modeling and simulation of cellular physiology and bioprocesses, and integrate it with our genetic design platform, Kernel. As the developer of the modeling and simulation platform, you’ll use a combination of data-centric and component-based architecture to give computational biologists modular and extensible tools for solving complex multiscale and multiphysics problems. This is a unique opportunity to work at a nimble, forward-thinking synthetic biology startup and help build the foundation for computer aided bioengineering.                    Opportunities and responsibilities:             Develop the first software for end-to-end design of synthetic biological systems and bioprocesses  Develop modular and extensible software for scientific computing across synthetic biology, computational biology, and bioprocess domains  Apply advanced numerical analysis techniques to efficiently solve complex dynamic simulation and optimization problems  Work with a modern backend stack to integrate new functionality with our platform  Collaborate with computational biologists to predict and optimize bioprocess performance  Deploy bioprocess and cell models into commercial software  Be directly involved in the long-term computational biology roadmap at Asimov  Be directly involved in building our technology platform, business strategy, and company culture                          Preferred qualifications:             M.S. and five years of experience, or Ph.D. and two years of experience developing scientific computing software  Experience with Python, Julia, or C++ and relevant applied math packages  Exercises best practices in development of clean, testable, maintainable code, e.g. git branching models, continuous integration, test-driven development, agile or extreme programming  Successful deployment of scientific computing applications to end users  Practical experience in several of the following domains and skills: differential equations, constrained optimization (gradient-based or gradient-free), distributed computing, MapReduce, linear and quadratic programming, supervised learning, genetic algorithms, MCMC, numerical analysis, data-centric and component-based designs                          About you:              You are a highly skilled software engineer with a background in scientific computing, computational biology, or computer science with experience in industry or applied research positions. You’re motivated by the challenge of solving large, complex applied math problems. You’re a strong critical thinker and enjoy designing sustainable, modular, and extensible software to address novel problems in biotechnology. You may have strong opinions about design patterns and code smells. And finally, you’re excited to work with agility in a dynamic team of diverse skills in computer science, computational biology, and physics.                  We're fueled by a vision to transform biological engineering into a fully-fledged engineering discipline. Should you join our team, you will grow with a constantly evolving organization and push the frontiers of synthetic biology. Company culture is key to Asimov, and ours is a culture of recombination; we believe that our mission can only be achieved by bringing together a diverse team with a mixture of backgrounds and perspectives.

job_title: Senior Technical Product Manager - Machine Learning
job_Description: The Lead Product (Platform) Success Manager will be hyper-focused on enabling the Data Science and ML Engineering teams to drive successful outcomes leveraging ML Platforms. Through tight partnership with partner teams and through deep alignment with Product teams, this person will surface insights from the customer and work with the ML Platforms PMs to prioritize the work. This person will capture desired outcomes and map the use case-specific journeys of the Data Science teams and directly influence the product roadmap.  This person will act as a trusted advisor to ML Platforms’ users by enabling them to use our products to conduct end to end ML lifecycle and achieve business objectives. Partner with users to develop and execute ML Platforms usage and success plans, by leveraging programmatic and technical strategies to meet the business objectives and stakeholder goals. Work with users to remove technical barriers and drive broader ML Platforms adoption. Further, recommend best practices to accelerate their onboarding and migration plans. Act as a user advocate for product features and requirements.  KPIs you will own and drive:   Adoption (users, models) on to the platform  Velocity gain (e.g. time to onboard, reduction in subsequent support requests)  ML Plats NPS (support and onboarding)   The Work   Own and drive the DS partnerships and serve as the PM for three data science teams when evaluating ML Plats, design/architecture support, onboarding and velocity gain  Leverage your deep knowledge of distributed systems engineering to build Wayfair’s next generation Machine Learning capabilities  Understand technical requirements for ML Platforms, synthesize them into investment themes and OKRs, partner with product managers to prioritize backlog  Capture desired outcomes for the Data Science teams and map model lifecycle and directly influence the platform roadmap  Think outside of the current technology/stack limitations to push the boundaries on what is possible and deliver feasible solutions collaboratively  Be the subject matter expert of Wayfair’s ML capabilities  Market your product internally to various departments to ensure all available users know about your product and how they could value from it  Translate business initiatives into engineering stories/tickets, allowing engineering to run with your ideas  Maintain a project plan and roadmap, keeping stakeholders and constituents up to date on the top level goals and timelines  Regularly communicate our quarterly/monthly goals and progress to keep business stakeholders apprised of your work and product progress   Your Background   5+ years of experience of product management or platform success role for a Saas product working with internal and external customers  Technical background/experience to be able to self troubleshoot technical issues, drive high level implementation discussions, and create customer adoption and success plans  Strong written and verbal communication  Hands on experience with public cloud (AWS, GCP or Azure)  Familiarity to Airflow, Containers, Kubernetes, Microservices, ML frameworks  About Wayfair Inc.  Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston or Berlin, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry-leading technology and creative problem-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.  No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We’re a community of innovators, risk-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair – and world – for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or genetic information.

Day Zero Diagnostics (DZD) is an exciting startup revolutionizing infectious disease diagnostics, by leveraging cutting-edge sample prep technologies, whole genome sequencing and machine learning. We are building the next generation of IVDs, able to perform comprehensive bacterial species ID and antimicrobial resistance and susceptibility (AMR/S) profiling in less than 8 hours of sample receipt, without the need for culture. By providing an accurate and comprehensive diagnosis within the first cycle of treatment, patients can get appropriate antibiotic therapy for systemic infections such as sepsis, reducing hospital treatment durations and costs.      At DZD, we are passionate about our mission of modernizing infectious diseases diagnosis and treatment. Employees gain experience in a multidisciplinary and fast-paced start-up, and have ample opportunities to acquire new skills, engage with emerging technologies, work closely with our accomplished team, and communicated their results, all while working in a supportive and energetic environment.      As a marketing manager, you will help DZD promote its technologies, products and services to multiple target audiences. You will report to the head of business development, and independently perform the operational and compliance functions of marketing in the company. You will collaborate with our scientific, technical and operational teams.      Responsibilities:          Own lead generation activities, including market segmentation and strategic account profiling      Manage all of DZD’s digital channels, including online and social media content, SEO, digital campaigns with corresponding KPIs.      Plan, coordinate and execute DZD’s conference and trade show strategy and activities.      Hold admin rights to DZD’s CRM system.      Be an active contributor to development of messaging and marketing collateral for product marketing and PR activities.         Qualifications:          Bachelor’s degree with background in marketing, communications, business or related field      3+ years of experience in a similar role or in a marketing agency serving similar clients      Excellent time management and organizational skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines and work with budgets      Exceptional verbal and written communication skills and excellent attention to detail      Self-directed, taking initiative to work toward identified marketing objectives      Experience working with content management systems, email marketing tools and CRM systems. Experience working with design tools is preferred      Life sciences industry and start-up experience is preferred

Business Analytics Manager             Work you'll do          The Strategic Finance team provides analytical and finance services in support of the Deloitte. Within Operations & Finance, the Analytics team specializes in providing a forward-looking perspective and helping leadership to make key business decisions. Charles River Analytics creates solutions and technology to tackle the world's most challenging problems. Our team of technological entrepreneurs works together to push at the forefront of enhanced AI, cyber security, robotics, and human-centered computing. The resulting research and development help to continuously advance government programs and discover new possibilities in the commercial marketplace. We are a 100% employee-owned company, encouraging participation, innovation, and responsibility from our entire staff. At Charles River, we take great pride in our success at attracting and retaining the most talented and creative problem-solvers in our field. Are you interested in being an Employee Owner at one of Boston's Best Places to Work? If this sounds like you, then we'd love to hear from you!  Charles River Analytics is seeking a passionate, experienced senior scientist to help expand the variety of techniques we use to conduct innovative research to address real-world challenges. Within our Human-Centered AI division, we are specifically looking for talented individuals with a background in one or more of the following areas in artificial intelligence and machine learning or similar:   Machine learning from large or small amounts of data  Commonsense reasoning and integrating domain knowledge with deep learning  Decision-making and decision analysis  Knowledge representation and reasoning  Control theory and autonomous systems  Probabilistic modeling and reasoning  Automated planning and scheduling  Modeling and simulation of complex systems   At Charles River Analytics, you will take your experience to address challenging problems in domains such as explainable artificial intelligence, cyber security, command and control, autonomous vehicles, predictive health maintenance, intelligence analysis, health, and medical, and environmental and humanitarian applications. You will lead tightly knit, project-oriented teams of both scientists and software engineers to create software prototypes of new research concepts. You will lead your team to understand the problem, research approaches, design solutions, and evaluate the results. You will connect to and collaborate with researchers at top universities and research labs to create the next generation of AI technologies. You will publish papers, attend conferences, and communicate results through verbal and written means. At Charles River Analytics, we foster an environment where scientists have the flexibility to pursue their own research interests and are supported by a community of bright, enthusiastic individuals to help them thrive.  How you will make an impact:   Develop business in various DoD, Intelligence Community, and Government R&D organizations by crafting and presenting innovative technical solutions to potential new customers  Lead teams of scientists, software engineers, and subject matter experts  Research, analyze, and design algorithms for decision-support systems and automation  Pursue novel technologies to implement solutions, including establishing new areas of research  Analyze and understand domain challenges and user needs  Conduct technical discussions with customers  Lead and contribute to proposal efforts for new projects  Publish papers, reports, and present work at briefings and conferences   What we are seeking: PhD degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field or equivalent work experience  Passion for evangelizing the unique benefits of specific R&D concepts that you develop  Demonstrated ability to regularly develop new methods/approaches to create novel contributions to the state of the art  Demonstrated ability to lead identification of technical, user, and customer-focused opportunities  Strong verbal and written skills to support proposal writing, interaction with customers, and presentations at technical conferences  U.S. Citizenship   Our ideal candidate has: Experience working with US defense and intelligence research organizations, including DARPA, ONR, AFRL, ARL, and IARPA and/or with other defense-related R&D companies  Experience commercializing technology or transitioning advanced research  Strong reputation in your field of practice; experts encouraged to apply  A record of publications in relevant communities  Knowledge and experience with software languages and platforms   Why CRA?  Charles River Analytics is a 100% employee-owned company that thrives on collaboration and values each employee-owner. We offer employee ownership, competitive compensation plus bonus and profit-sharing, with an attractive benefits package including 100% employer-paid medical and dental insurance, as well as vision, life, and disability insurance, paid maternity/paternity leave, tuition reimbursement, monthly gym allowance, free parking, generous paid time off, and a casual environment. We offer tremendous flexibility and value work-life balance. We are also accessible by public transportation.

About Zapata      Zapata Computing, Inc. is a quantum software, services, and applications company with a mission to accelerate the quantum revolution. We are developing quantum algorithms to solve critical problems across a wide range of industries. Zapata’s platform Orquestra™ combines a powerful software platform and quantum algorithm libraries to deliver real-world solutions across a full range of classical and quantum technologies.        We are committed to creating an environment that accelerates our engineers' growth and positive impact in the world. Science and engineering here is fast-paced, highly collaborative, and cross-disciplinary. Our world-class quantum scientists, researchers and programmers are creative, curious, and resourceful problem solvers with a revolutionary mindset.        About the job      The Quantum Software Team strives to enable researchers, engineers, and data scientists to efficiently and reliably solve computational problems with quantum and quantum-inspired algorithms. As a Mathematical Optimization Engineer on the Quantum Software Team, you will design and build tools to help scientists and engineers develop, assess, and deploy emerging techniques and technologies for mathematical optimization problems.        Responsibilities          As part of a team, develop and maintain software packages for performing mathematical optimization Zapata’s Orquestra™ platform.        Identify, make, and document design decisions for such packages.      Support scientists and engineers who use the tools that you build.      Collaborate with stakeholders to incorporate user feedback into features, fixes, and modifications.                Team values          Cooperation in prioritization of work, science, and engineering decisions.      Willingness to adapt priorities as needed to meet the demands of our team and end users.      Team success as a shared accomplishment with diversity in thought and experience.      Open communication and willingness to respectfully engage with others.                Minimum qualifications          Bachelor's degree in mathematics, computer science, or related field plus four years relevant work experience, or masters degree plus two years relevant work experience.      Experience designing an API for a library in a modern language such as Python, Rust, C++, or Julia.      Familiarity with software for mathematical optimization such as Gurobi, CPLEX, or SCIP.                Preferred qualifications          Experience writing high-performance code in Rust, C++, Julia, or other languages.      Experience with the full software development lifecycle, including designing, building, and iterating on a software project.      Experience in a startup environment.        Knowledge of quantum computing and quantum algorithms for optimization.           Locations          Option to be remote or come into the office. We have locations in Boston MA, Brentwood TN, and Toronto Ontario Canada.        Although the work can be performed remotely from most locations, team members will be expected to be able to work with team members in U.S. Eastern or Central European time zones.                Zapata is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.        Compensation is dependent on numerous factors including but not limited to location, experience level, current market conditions

Day Zero Diagnostics (DZD) is an exciting startup revolutionizing infectious disease diagnostics, by leveraging cutting-edge sample prep technologies, whole genome sequencing and machine learning. We are building the next generation of IVDs, able to perform comprehensive bacterial species ID and antimicrobial resistance and susceptibility (AMR/S) profiling in less than 8 hours of sample receipt, without the need for culture.     Our first application is for Sepsis. Sepsis is responsible for about a third of hospital deaths and costs hospitals in the US about $24B annually. Using the current culture-based approach for pathogen ID and AST that takes 2-5 days and has a 40% failure rate, patients with Sepsis are treated with broad-spectrum antibiotics, leading to significant toxicity, higher rates of organ injury, increased risk of  c. difficile  infection, and contributing to the growth of the antibiotic resistance problem, globally.      By providing an accurate and comprehensive diagnosis within the first cycle of treatment, patients can get appropriate antibiotic therapy for systemic infections such as sepsis, reducing hospital treatment durations and costs.     At Day Zero Diagnostics we are passionate about our mission of modernizing infectious diseases diagnosis and treatment. Employees gain experience in a multidisciplinary and fast-paced start-up, and have ample opportunities to acquire new skills, engage with emerging technologies, work closely with our accomplished team, and communicate their results, all while working in a supportive and energetic environment.         Job Duties:          Receive and process specimens for DNA sequencing      Conduct DNA sequencing bench workflows - library prep and DNA sequencer operation (Illumina and Oxford Nanopore)      Work closely under the supervision of Director of Sequencing Technologies, and in coordination with other Genomic Sequencing Technicians, as well as Lab Research Associates, and Research Scientists from our other teams      Ensure stringent quality control of equipment, reagents, and samples      Maintain meticulous documentation of experimental procedures and outcomes and contribute to reports      Maintain close communication with direct supervisor and members of the research teams you support      Follow established laboratory protocols for research and clinical services         Qualifications required:          At least 1 year of laboratory experience outside of course work (during or after your degree program). Degree in molecular biology, biochemistry, microbiology, or related disciplines preferred but not required.        Desired: Direct prior experience conducting DNA sequencing. Experience with lab automation (liquid handling robotics). Familiarity and enthusiasm for bioinformatics, computational biology, programming languages, robotics, lab instrumentation, etc. are positives, but not requisites         This will be an engaging and rewarding role. It is imperative that you:          Set objectives and plan work based on agreed outcomes      Meet deadlines and iteratively assess priorities to handle fluctuating workloads      Work at exceptional levels of accuracy, attention to detail, and attention to safety      Be flexible to occasionally work after hours when other alternatives aren’t available      Have excellent verbal, written, communication, organization, and time management skills         If this sounds like an opportunity well-suited to your background, interests, and aptitudes, please provide:      Your most recent resume or CV (including degree earned and GPA)     A cover letter describing how you see the alignment between this position and your career      A minimum of 3 references we can contact should your candidacy progress to that stage

Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Who We Are Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we work closely with clients to embrace a transformational approach aimed at benefiting all stakeholders—empowering organizations to grow, build sustainable competitive advantage, and drive positive societal impact. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives that question the status quo and spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting, technology and design, and corporate and digital ventures. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, fueled by the goal of helping our clients thrive and enabling them to make the world a better place. Digital BCG BCG has a long history of driving growth by embracing innovation and new ways of thinking. Through DigitalBCG, we bring together a diverse mix of consultants and digital specialists to ensure that we are supporting our clients throughout their digital transformation journeys. We work with our clients to fully understand the impact of digital on their business and set priorities that will transform their vision into value. Whether it be developing new technologies to support their core business, making better use of their data, or pursuing entirely new sources of revenue, our aim is to achieve radical improvements in productivity, flexibility, and speed. We are innovating how our clients are using artificial intelligence, robotic process automation, internet of things, personalization, blockchain technologies, and more to gain competitive advantage. DigitalBCG encompasses a broad set of data, digital, and technology capabilities from BCG consulting teams and practices, along with our business units such as BCG Digital Ventures, BCG Platinion, and BCG GAMMA. Practice Area Profile What You'll Do DigitalBCG  is building the future of business today. Right now, every company in every industry is on a journey to become a digital organization. Our goal is to make that journey a success. As a  DigitalBCG Project Leader , you will partner with leading companies to shift mindsets, shape agendas, and create value through digital transformation programs. The work you do every day—going deep to uncover key insights and reimagine business models—will enable our clients to compete in today’s fast-paced environment and accelerate into the digital future. As you immerse yourself in new challenges across a range of Digital topics, you will develop close relationships with senior clients and BCG leadership, and play a central role in work that has a lasting impact on companies, industries, and society. As a DigitalBCG Project Leader, you will lead a team of BCG consultants and digital specialists advising clients on a range of topics that align to your areas of expertise and interests, including, but not limited to the following: Digital Transformation & Strategy:  Helping clients rethink the impact of digital on their business and accelerate their transformation efforts. Customer Centricity:  Reinventing the Customer Experience, leveraging journey maps, deep customer empathy, and data to create transformative digital interfaces, marketing strategies, and process innovations. Digital Marketing & Personalization:  Optimizing digital marketing programs across all digital channels and levers, including precision marketing, and analytics-enabled, one-to-one personalization. Big Data & Analytics:  Driving transformational value through cutting-edge applications of AI and Machine Learning tools that are fully scaled into the business. New Ways of Working:  Building ongoing organizational change capabilities, and helping clients transform into digital enterprises that continue to develop and innovate with speed, at scale. Transformation of the Technology Function and Technology Build:  Redesigning technology functions to improve flexibility, efficiency, and Business-IT alignment. As a Digital Strategy Project Leader, you can expect to spend the majority of your time working on digital topics, and the balance working on a broader set of critical, unique challenges presented by our clients. Project Leaders work at the forefront of client engagements, serving as a key driver of client value. At BCG, we set our standard for value creation high, challenging ourselves to deliver tangible and positive change, not simply presentations or ideas. Our work must provide next-level insights, change the mindset of our clients, and lead directly to clients taking action and executing their business in new ways. In addition to managing the holistic program for clients, you will also coach and inspire your team to develop their consulting and digital skills, creating opportunities for team members to learn and grow. Working alongside BCG and client project leaders, you will contribute expertise, synthesize recommendations, challenge work in progress, and re-orient analyses as necessary. Finally, you will contribute to BCG’s intellectual capital in the digital space, defining industry leading thinking, helping build BCG’s brand as a digital leader. What You'll Bring (Experience & Qualifications) A minimum of 5+ years of full-time work experience within digital fields, including product management, digital marketing & analytics, and/or designing & delivering world-class software products, in leading digital companies and/or start-ups. Ideally 3-5 years of experience in a consulting environment, driving large-scale transformations, with a history of excellent client service. Core consulting skills are critically important in this role: Strong analytic skills and a high capacity for conceptual thinking. Ability to develop leading-edge business models, frameworks for analysis, and long-term business strategies that maximize shareholder value. Must be able to thrive in a hypothesis-based environment where inductive rather than deductive reasoning is the norm. Deep experience and clear alignment with at least one industry where we could see an immediate fit with our business. History of building credibility and relationships with leaders, technical and non-technical people to align on strategy, inspire stakeholders, and execute on a day-to-day basis. The ability to work with and lead multi-disciplinary teams including engineers, architects, data scientists—or whatever is required to solve the client’s challenge—will be vital to success. Proven experience managing the end-to-end product lifecycle, determining the product vision and roadmap, delivering strong customer experiences, and managing stakeholder interactions. Advanced quantitative analysis, solid business acumen and problem solving ability. High capacity for strategic/end-to-end thinking. Excellent communication and persuasion skills. Strong academics from a MS or MBA preferred Demonstrated ability to manage client engagements, client relationships, and provide “thought leadership” to teams, fully owning the responsibility for the quality of engagements. A solid track record of building strong client relationships with large organizations, as well as identifying opportunities to deepen those relationships and grow the business. The companies that are winning the digital future are those that embrace digital diversity: diverse perspectives, diverse skills, and diverse capabilities. BCG’s digital teams reflect this diversity, combining digital-savvy business consultants and industry experts with a full spectrum of digital specialists. As you collaborate with BCG Associates, Consultants, and Principals, you will increase your understanding of complex business problems from a wide range of perspectives and develop new skills. At the same time, you’ll partner with senior clients, taking on the role of trusted advisor, and work at all levels of the client organization to find and execute value creation strategies that result in game changing outcomes for our clients. YOU’LL BE BASED IN: We are currently hiring for all our North American offices. YOU’LL BE TRAVELING: Moderate to significant travel is expected.  Candidates should be aware that BCG currently maintains a policy requiring all US & Canada based employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Newly hired employees must be fully vaccinated prior to their employment start date. BCG is an equal opportunity employer and will provide a reasonable accommodation to those unable to be vaccinated for medical or religious reasons where it is not an undue hardship to the company to do so as provided under applicable federal, state, provincial and local law. FOR U.S. APPLICANTS: Boston Consulting Company (“BCG”) is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. The state of Colorado requires BCG to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. This compensation range is specific to individuals applying to work in our Denver office and takes into account a number of factors. A reasonable estimate of the range for this role is $210,000 to $217,000. BCG offers a comprehensive benefits program, including medical, dental and vision coverage, telemedicine services, life, accident and disability insurance, parental leave and family planning benefits, caregiving resources, mental health offerings, a generous retirement program, financial guidance, paid time off, and more.

Service Operations Analyst  - (3193590)              About Us      As a not-for-profit organization, Mass General Brigham is committed to supporting patient care, research, teaching, and service to the community by leading innovation across our system. Founded by Brigham and Women’s Hospital and Massachusetts General Hospital, Mass General Brigham supports a complete continuum of care including community and specialty hospitals, a managed care organization, a physician network, community health centers, home care and other health-related entities. Several of our hospitals are teaching affiliates of Harvard Medical School, and our system is a national leader in biomedical research.    We’re focused on a people-first culture for our system’s patients and our professional family. That’s why we provide our employees with more ways to achieve their potential. Mass General Brigham is committed to aligning our employees’ personal aspirations with projects that match their capabilities and creating a culture that empowers our managers to become trusted mentors. We support each member of our team to own their personal development—and we recognize success at every step.    Our employees use the Mass General Brigham values to govern decisions, actions and behaviors. These values guide how we get our work done: Patients, Affordability, Accountability & Service Commitment, Decisiveness, Innovation & Thoughtful Risk; and how we treat each other: Diversity & Inclusion, Integrity & Respect, Learning, Continuous Improvement & Personal Growth, Teamwork & Collaboration.      Summary      Mass General Brigham’s board and system-wide executive leadership are making significant investments in enterprise data and digital health, enabling innovation and transformation in the delivery of health care, research, and discovery. By building out core digital and data capabilities, we are supporting the achievement of Mass General Brigham’s mission to drive growth and innovation in inpatient, ambulatory, and digital care. We are at the start of this journey, and we are looking for talented individuals from across the nation to join us in transforming healthcare and in achieving the expected outcomes of this strategy: improved patient care, quality of care, patient engagement, and efficiency in the delivery of healthcare with excellence.      In the achievement of these goals, Mass General Brigham’s data and analytic teams are working together to build a system-wide data ecosystem. We are leveraging both current assets and building new, integrated solutions to provide a holistic set of industry-leading data and analytic capabilities, supporting Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning (ML), and real-time insights. Teams from Data and Analytics, Research Analytics, Clinical Data Science, and Information Systems are collaborating to build this new data and analytic ecosystem. To ensure success of this effort, Mass General Brigham is standing up a new Data and Analytics operating model with a goal of driving a level of standardization for data and analytic operations across the teams involved.       The value of investments in data and analytics were proven out during our response to COVID-19 as these investments were leveraged to stand up new reporting and analytic capabilities to support executive and clinical leadership on managing the pandemic. Our broad data and analytic community have come together across Mass General Brigham ’s 14 healthcare sites with shared urgency, delivering analytic tools to our system that drove timely insights in both clinical and operational domains, resulting in effective delivery of critical care and in organizational efficiencies during a time of reduced resources.      Team Description      The Service Operations Analyst will join the Mass General Brigham Digital: Data and Analytics Team which focuses on the ‘End User’, or the personas, that utilize Data and Analytics products and services after they have been fully developed, marketed, and deployed. The vision is to create and maintain a comprehensive service model, standardizing processes and tools across the data and analytics community.      In our current state many teams within Data & Analytics manage their own support, intake, security access, and end user education and self-service in slightly different ways. There are strategic efforts underway to provide a front door for data and analytics and act as a gateway for the end users. This strategic effort will be iterative as we begin to centralize functions within this growing team. The Service Operations Analyst will provide support to the team and this effort.      The Service Operations Analyst will:      Manage all aspects of Data and Analytics project requests from submission through handoff to the appropriate team      Support the Data and Analytic community, tracking and managing project requests throughout the intake lifecycle, communicating status to stakeholders, coordinating across platform teams to scope and assess requests, and documenting details for review      Provide a positive end-user experience and be a key point of service contact for MGB Data and Analytics community seeking assistance      Act as frontline support for a variety of Data & Analytics products and services, facilitating analysis of issues, new requests, and enhancements      Review access requests to ensure information is complete and appropriate approvals are provided prior to provisioning access      Build and maintain knowledge content and end user facing training materials to assist in end-user self-service capabilities      The work is rapidly evolving, and the Service Operations Analyst must be able to operate in an agile manner and respond to significant change within Data and Analytics as teams evolve to the new strategic plans.      The Service Operations Analyst will report to the Manager of Service Operations & End User Enablement.      Principal Duties and Responsibilities:      Daily Intake Management      Drive intake requests through lifecycle of data collection, evaluation, and approval      Act as a liaison between customers and internal Data and Analytic teams to assure accurate problem or request interpretation. Courteously obtain and convey concise problem information as needed to properly inform escalated issues and minimize re-work in hand-offs      Prepare, coordinate, and facilitate cross team meetings with site and Data and Analytic representation required to identify requirements and confirm scope of requests      Daily Tier 1 Support/Access Management      Responsible for first level contact of support for data and analytic products and services including the Enterprise Data Warehouse, Data Lake, Tableau Dashboards, and other teams as defined      Provide a high degree of customer service      Responsible for providing a thoughtful initial assessment of all requests, resolving issues within their abilities quickly, and escalating in a timely manner when beyond their capabilities      Assist Data Access & Security Lead with the access request process for all data repositories within the ecosystem allowing for a centralized and coordinated process for all users, leading this workflow when necessary      Coordinate and track identity management and access maintenance procedures      Track progress of tickets and follows up with other support staff involved to ensure service requests and incidents are resolved and customer communication is complete      Continually grow general knowledge of company culture, systems, and applications to increase the ability to resolve requests on first contact      Metric/Status Reporting      Develop and manage reports and dashboards, focusing on KPIs      Assist Data and Analytics teams and leadership with metric needs      Create presentations and status/project reports as needed      Monitor established SLA’s and conducts follow ups as needed      Knowledge Base Development      Document all useful or repetitive issue resolution or tips and tricks for use in the Center of Excellence      Work across the workstreams within the Data and Analytics Center of Excellence to support and build a knowledge base repository to help drive self-service and efficient problem resolution      Identify opportunities to enhance the user support knowledge base and/or create new user support aids, including FAQs, tip sheets, and trainings      Other Responsibilities      Drive development, documentation, and process improvement efforts within team      Continuously evaluate the Data and Analytics intake approach to make process improvements, and ensure effective and efficient workflow is used to expedite evaluation of requests      Use/s the Mass General Brigham values to govern decisions, actions, and
